intro: Stomoisia juncea, commonly known as the narrowleaf stomoisia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Americas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and has slender, branching stems. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Stomoisia juncea is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
